article.title: Amortized entanglement of a quantum channel and approximately teleportation-simulable channels

multiple_choice_question.text: Which statement best describes the concept of "amortized entanglement" as depicted in Figure 1?
choices: It represents the total entanglement present in the output state of the quantum channel.
It measures the entanglement of the input state before processing by the quantum channel.
It captures the largest possible increase in entanglement between the input and output states of the channel.
It quantifies the minimum entanglement required in a shared resource state to simulate the channel.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 illustrates a protocol for which quantum communication task?
What does the formula E<sub>A</sub>(N) = sup<sub>ρAAB</sub>[E(A\';BB\')<sub>θ</sub> - E(AA;B\')<sub>ρ</sub>]  represent?
choices: The difference in entanglement between a state ρ and its purification θ.
The entanglement of the quantum channel N.
The amortized entanglement of the quantum channel N.
The maximum entanglement achievable by the LOCC channel.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula N<sub>A→B</sub>(ρ<sub>A</sub>) = L<sub>ARB→B</sub>(ρ<sub>A</sub> ⊗ ω<sub>RB</sub>) define?
choices: A channel simulation using an arbitrary shared resource state.
A teleportation-simulable quantum channel with resource state ω<sub>RB</sub>.
The general structure of a secret key agreement protocol.
The condition for approximate covariance of a quantum channel.
